intro: Styloma, commonly known as the "tongue plant," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its unique, elongated flower structures that resemble a tongue, hence its common name. The flowers are typically blue or violet in color and are arranged in clusters, often with a tubular shape. Styloma species are native to various regions in Africa, Madagascar, and the Arabian Peninsula. These plants are often found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions.
